website_summaries.verdict: An exceptional choice if you want the best Canon has to offer in a multifunctional model: printer, copier, and scanner. Reliable quality and wireless connectivity for a reasonable price.
pros: An all-in-one unit with exceptional print quality for documents, photos, copies, and scanned items
cons: Goes through ink fairly quickly when printing photos and some documents
A bit challenging to set up

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new printer, and after reading a number of reviews and the many features on this Canon MG7720, we decided to move ahead with purchasing it. Best decision we made. The initial setup did take a little bit of time, but once you get through this first step adding it to your additional iPads or iPhones gets much faster. As far as printing is concerned it's pretty fast. I was also very impressed with the quality of printing color photos. As an example, my wife printed a copy of our grandson on photo paper, and wow! the quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: wilfig12

customer_reviews.title: Not Windows 10 compatible
customer_reviews.text: I've used Canon all-in-one inkjet printers for 15 to 20 years now, and I am satisfied again with this great product. My one disappointment though was this model was a current version, but only supported Windows 8. I installed it with Windows 10 and it works fine, as far as I have noticed in the past 24 hours. The installation though is an issue. The dialog windows are small and the selection buttons at the button were truncated. I had to guess which one to select, and fortunately I guessed correctly so the installation was quick and easy. This will be a problem for some not as lucky.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Forsing

customer_reviews.title: Jammed from Day one - Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design. Paper jammed on first print and trying to get the jam out of this printer is very difficult. The front does not open up fully so you can get to the jam and having to take off the rear pieces a pain. Tried to print 5 times and it jammed every time. I have a 5300 series and never had an issue. This one is trying to be too compact. Time to look for another printer. Guess I'll try HP or Brother this time.
customer_reviews.author: MacHans

customer_reviews.title: Don 't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is truly a piece of junk. It worked fine for 2 months then suddenly stopped functioning correctly. Each time I try to print a document, the machine sends an error message stating the paper tray is empty. The only resolution is to shut down the printer and reboot. This makes a total printing time of approximately 5 minutes to print one document. And it grinds and grinds and grinds and grinds seemingly forever when it does print a document. Don't waste your money. Also don't buy for this seller. They do not accept returns. Hopefully I can get some help from Cannon because this beast won't even make for a nice planter or storage box.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Super frustrating - Save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT recommend this printer. I have had it for a few weeks and have only used it a few times, because overall, it's just a hassle. It's large, noisy and takes a long time to power up. So far, half the time I have used it, it says that it has printed and nothing comes out, or it just feeds a blank page. An extremely frustrating product to work with. Constant "error" messages that seem needless and don't help to resolve anything. I thought this Canon would be an upgrade from my previous Epson, but I honestly miss the ease of just turning on a printer and printing a document!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Prints Beautiful Photos
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that the set-up was easy, but, then, I'm not savvy with devices. With perseverance, I was able to get devices "talking" to each other and am now able to print without keeping my fingers crossed. Please consider that these remarks are coming from an 87-yr.-old and realize that many people would probably find the setting up effortless. I must add that a Canon representative was extremely patient and helpful when I was completely stumped and needed help. In time, I am confident that I will be comfortable with this printer, and I should say that the photos I have printed are beautiful, which was my primary reason for choosing a Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: DROP130

customer_reviews.title: Not so simple printer
customer_reviews.text: I would have preferred a printer with less technology and not as difficult to just "print". Must download programs which are great if that is what you'll use it for. Just wanted a plain ole printer that can print, scan and fax. But need to be up on technology. And 5 ink cartridges-- 2 black, what is that all about? It is now about 5 months later and having major problems with it. Takes a long time to recognize and print. For the past two days the printer isn't recognized and needed to run diagnostics on it and the "print spoiler" wasn't running. Repaired it. For the next three items had to repeat the process with diagnostics.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Luck

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer!!! Wireless set-up was a breeze and printing documents and photos is working flawlessly. Can't believe the deal I got on this printer!! Best Buy has it on sale for 149.99 and I got it through Amazon for 68.00 and it arrived in two days as usual!!! I've already printed quite a few 5x7 photos and am quite impressed with the results. If you are looking for a decent all in one printer that won't break the bank and does photos good enough too frame then grab one of these before they're gone!!!! Thanks Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: OldthorTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Revised review
customer_reviews.text: So far, its holding up very well. Good prints and not difficult to use. I use generic inks to save money, and there are no problems. If its still going good next year, I'll give it 5 stars. I believe I jinxed myself in my initial review (above). Not even a year old and the black print nozzle is dead. Performed cleaning function about 6-7 times. Performed the "deep clean" function 4 times. Used alcohol on the head and soaked it up until the alcohol came clean (a 3 hour project). All other colors print excellent, but no black. This is the second Canon printer that has done this to me! What do I buy next?
customer_reviews.author: Larry C.

customer_reviews.title: Never Again
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER UNLESS YOU OWN AN INK FACTORY. Printed less than 120 pages 98% in draft/grayscale plus a few in color and all ink colors are almost gone. Why should printing in black only use the other color as well? This is my 3rd and last Canon printer. Canon should be ashamed of producing this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Fantasitc prints, great on regular paper, seperate cartridges for eah color and on sale!  Can't be beat!
customer_reviews.text: Printer is fantastic! Photos are the best I have printed ever, but it IS a Canon. It truly seems to use less ink in daily use than the HP it replaced. Setup and user interface were so simple anyone could do it. I was printing photos from my phone in less than 5 minutes. The only negative I have is that the lower paper tray will not hold very much paper. Too little in my opinion, but I could not find an HP at this price point with separate ink cartridges for each color which this DOES have. 6 actually! C,M,Y,K, Grey, Black, Photo Black.
customer_reviews.author: Man-guy

customer_reviews.title: Buggy Little Devil
customer_reviews.text: The printer absolutely refuses to stay online. The print quality is good and the functions are good also, (scanning, copying) but it constantly goes offline and will not be recognized. You have to remove the device numerous times and eventually it will allow itself to be discovered. I have played this game so many times it's maddening. Today, I decided to replace this buggy little monster with something hopefully more reliable and write this review to save other from obliviously adding this this frustrating little turd to their cart. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t buy Canon, I beg you!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a complete and total piece of garbage. It chugs ink like a drunk chugs a beer. The quality has always been off. Lines aren’t ever straight. No amount of maintenance cleans the heads, alignment, nozzles or whatever else sucks on this printer. The WiFi is god awful. The worst problem is that is just wont print half the time when it’s connected properly. After dealing with this for the past couple of years I decided it was enough and pulled an Office Space and smashed that piece of crap to pieces. I feel much better and will never buy a canon printer again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped printing black ink after 18 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 18 months, and would say we use it weekly, but not for my work. It's mainly used to print return labels and kids' school projects. it worked fine until we installed the latest update, and now it won't print black ink. All of the ink cartridges are full, and they are OEM. It actually has two black ink cartridges. I've Googled this and apparently it's a fairly common issue. It's really crazy - I can no longer print shipping labels because you cannot change the printing color.
customer_reviews.author: Bethwr

customer_reviews.title: It functions correctly and prints high quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: I like every thing about it except the price of ink. Personally I think Cannon should give there printers out at a lower cost with a commitment to purchase ink directly from them, as the profit for all manufactures of printers is repeating the sale of ink not the one time purchase of the equipment. Like everyone else I have purchased many new printers some last six months others for a year but this one is over three years old and continues to operate as new. The bottom line is I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Bikers56flh

customer_reviews.title: Dies during software update
customer_reviews.text: My wireless printer required a software update so I initiated the update. In the middle of the update, my xifinity wifi also performed and auto update. This confused my printer in a forever spinning mode. I hardwired the printer to continue with the update- but it is still confused. Now my printer is completely useless and cannot be corrected. Big waste of money. Note to mfg - if you are going to have a wireless printer - then a hardwire should be able to correct or reboot incase of a wireless signal blip.
customer_reviews.author: Jollykat70

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 hours of my life I'll never get back trying to get the printer to work with the print to CD software. Not user friendly to setup. Also, disappointed with how hard it was to connect to wireless. I got it to print documents and a photo, great quality but I needed the print to CD for my business and that was a nightmare to get it to work with the software. And I work with computers all the time.
customer_reviews.author: daryl

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of resources
customer_reviews.text: This printer stopped working a week after warranty expired. Before it quit it used copious amounts of ink. Canon rep was unsympathetic and acknowledged many others had same experience. Suggested I "just buy another printer" as it would cost more to repair. What a waste of resources. My old cheapo HP lasted almost 10 years, was still printing but had to feed 1 sheet at a time and it was wired. Wish I had kept it.
customer_reviews.author: llolli

customer_reviews.title: Always preparing to print vs. actually printing
customer_reviews.text: Patience is a virtue with this printer. It's always thinking and "preparing to print" instead of actually printing when you hit the print button. Print quality is fine. Easy to set up. Having to wait 2+ minutes for your document almost every time? Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: SM_chi

customer_reviews.title: Very Good printer/scanner  Only complaint - ink prices (like all inkjets)
customer_reviews.text: No issues, works well, easy to set up, auto dual side printing a +. Ink prices somewhat high, larger cartridges are available, last longer and are a better deal. The individual ink cartridges in this printer can save money. Print quality better than some others, hard to distinguish from other good printers. I don't use it for photos, but it prints very acceptable ones. A dedicated photo printer is better. Scanner easy to use either from front controls or software control. A dedicated photo/negative scanner is better, but for occasional use, it produces good results. All told, it's a better than average printer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good for 6 months...that’s about it
customer_reviews.text: Started off great. Print well, nice pics, etc. After a couple months the photo printing quality deteriorated to the point of not even worth bothering anymore. Since then, the scanning function seemed to stop working. It would still appear to go through the motions of scanning but would no longer pop up as a file on my computer. We’re now at the two year mark and basic black and white printing no longer works, despite adequate ink/toner.
customer_reviews.author: SOC

customer_reviews.title: very tedious with all steps
customer_reviews.text: I have had canon printers before, took awhile to set up, very tedious with all steps, took ages to get it set up "wi-fi" this one seems to like ink especially Grey , i used a generic cartridge after the one it came with ran out, didnt work "printer error" i purchased a twin pack of genuine canon 271GY On amazon, it still doesnt print legibly anymore, i have contacted Canon support, very annoying as i used to use it to print out ebay shipping labels and its imperative that the bar code is readable..not happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: macaroni

customer_reviews.title: AIR PRINT.
customer_reviews.text: AIR PRINT. How did we live in a world were this wasn't possible? I can print from my phone! All you need is the cannon print service app (its free) and connect to the same wifi network as your printer. I also have printed from my laptop, the print software has a two row menu shaped like a backwards "L" and personally I find it a bit cluttered but it only pops up when you use the printer so it is no big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristle

customer_reviews.title: When Canon love turns into deep disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine AT FIRST. Then everything started going down hill. At the 11nibth mark, the print nozzle stopped working... Waster a TON Of ink trying to troubleshoot it with Canon support. Conclusion: need a new price t nozzle. "We'll get that right out to you" (falls off face of Earth) I call back... "Oh we're sorry that part is on back order it will arrive in one month. If it doesn't please call us back." F you Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Gracia & Tirso

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER BUT INK TANKS AREN'T READ CORRECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick review. It prints excellent! When it tells you the ink tank is low buy the XL size BUT do not replace the tank until it runs completely out. You will no when this occurs because it will stop printing and force you to replace the tank. Why? Our black tank has been showing LOW for six months but has yet to run out. It appears that the tanks aren't read correctly, at least on ours. Our printer is used several times a week on average.
customer_reviews.author: just review it!

customer_reviews.title: VERY ANNOYING!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this piece of mess two years ago. My issue w/it is whenever I want to print anything, it NEVER feeds the paper unless I open the tray, flip the paper up, over and/or around. VERY ANNOYING!!! I had an HP for YEARS until it stopped working ... at least I felt as though I got my money's worth. I'm thinking of junking this Canon and going back to HP.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Ink too high, photo quality too low.
customer_reviews.text: I had read great reviews on this Canon printer, but it has not lived up to my expectations. Takes forever for it to quit buzzing and clicking before it starts printing, and goes through tiny ink cartridges ink way too fast for the cost of the Canon ink. Photo print quality was not up to my old HP. Canon should give their printers away just for the profit they make on the ink cartridges. I started having problems with the printer heads clogging up. I was using more ink trying to keep them clean than I was using printing. Searching for another printer, but it won't be a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, User-Friendy.
customer_reviews.text: User friendly. Automatically starts when a document is sent to print. Can be set to automatically shut off. Set up was somewhat confusing. Enclosed instructions have one method, Windows wants to install its own drivers, and the latest drivers are online. Suggest you delete Windows drivers, use Canon drivers, and don't fiddle too long. I called Geek Squad and let them deal with eliminating Win drivers. I replaced my HP all-in-one none too soon. Wish I hadn't waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: Skyscooter

customer_reviews.title: True review
customer_reviews.text: Works very good but wasn’t the easiest to get working. Thou I must say that once it’s working it works and does create the constant pain in the but software issues hp does and it’s software isn’t a cabillion gigs infecting ever file of your computer like hp. It doesn’t slow your system down and your start ups either, like hp👍🏻 Very good photos, oh and the sheet print time is good but what you must know is printers when you don’t use them often take time when you print the first page in a while, hp takes forever to print the first page and sounds like a junkyard this has fair time and sound levels on first page prints👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: jamie oxenreider

customer_reviews.title: Very Good - Question about photos though
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do everything advertised. The bells and whistles are appreciated, in particular two sided printing. I suggest viewing one of the several YouTube videos about setting the printer up, as the included Start UP sheet isn't all that clear.. My two issues to date (after 2 weeks) are (1) it seems some brands of 4x6 glossy paper doesn't work - hopefully Canon is going to require only Canon paper. (2) The imaging in photo copies is very good. Certainly superior to the HP printer it replaced. HOWEVER, I have noticed that the prints are somewhat darker than the originals. Does anyone know if there is a way to adjust the darkness (?) level?
customer_reviews.author: Donald Negri

customer_reviews.title: Will never purchase a Canon product again.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this printer while it worked. Replaced an ink cartridge and the printer will not recognize it. It is a new Canon cartridge at a cost of $21. The light to the cartridge is on, but the printer says "not there". I put another color cartridge to test it and the printer says "wrong color". Canon says to remove the printer head, clean the contacts, unplug the printer, blah, blah, blah. Did it all but stand on my head. Guess I have to go back to my Brother printer. Sad turn of events.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne A. Tampas, Esq.

customer_reviews.title: excellent home printer/scanner - for a SHORTwhile
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is excellent and speed is OK for an inexpensive home printer. I really like that it turns itself on when you send something to print. It's also pretty quiet. The scanner function works very well; clear scans and does it very quickly compared to my previous devices. On the downside, it too frequently goes through some sort of initialization or self cleaning, meaning I often have to wait a couple of minutes before is actually tarts printing. UPDATE: After only 10 months of light use it died. Probably just needs a new print head, however they are not available.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased from Amazon, Canon refuses warranty
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked great until a recommended firmware update by Canon. Then printer printed extremely slow. After several recommendations by Canon did not fix the problem, they recommended the printer be replaced. Sending them the proof of purchase which was within a year of the purchase date, they replied that replacement could not be done since Amozon acted as a storefront for an unauthorized seller.
customer_reviews.author: InWis

customer_reviews.title: this has been horrible. I was on the phone 2 hours with ...
customer_reviews.text: this has been horrible. I was on the phone 2 hours with cannon and they finally had it working. it shuts down constantly and will not print all the time. Constantly have to put password in to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: jhj

customer_reviews.title: High risk little reward.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 2016. Ink cartridge issues all along where printer didn’t recognize cartridges even though they were canon. Now, July 2019 there is a printer head problem code and canon can’t fix it. So 2 1/2 years with some headaches and now it’s toast. Not great durability or quality. Canon’s discounted replacement was same price as amazon regular price. Corporations are a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Tufte

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With Canon MG7720
customer_reviews.text: My network consists of cable modem connected to AirPort Extreme wireless router, and have a Mac Mini with OSX El Capitan connected wireless as well. Set up process is easy, just follow on screen instructions on the printer, no software installation necessary on Mac. Once setup is complete, I connected the printer to my router through wireless settings on the printer menu on the Printer, and entered the password of my router, very easy. I can now print from any device connected to my wireless network, iPhone included. All pages thus far have printed flawlessly with high quality.
customer_reviews.author: H. SOULE

customer_reviews.title: Canon MG7720 review.
customer_reviews.text: This printer MG7720 was problematic from the initial setup. Many hours were spent just trying to get it to work. It could best be described as a Royal pain in the " the you know where" It keeps on defaulting to manual flipping the page for printing. And so it is until today. Whenever am to do a simple print job, I have to spend hours to get it to work. I may throw it away or get a reliable one from Canon. A half star is the best that I can give it
customer_reviews.author: BPlummer

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with the performance and price
customer_reviews.text: The printer works flawlessly. I am very satisfied with the performance and price. However, I deducted two stars for an unfortunate characteristic that just presented itself. To scan a document to the cloud is a "premium service" and only available to customers who use original Canon ink? What? I didn't see that disclaimer in any of the sales literature! Seems to me, once purchased, I should have the option to use whatever ink that I want. The limiting of features which were a major selling point, for any reason, is, in my mind, very disingenuous.
customer_reviews.author: jamxke64

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable printing quality
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked great when we first got it. Though it seemed to use a lot of ink to clean the heads every time you turn it on. We don't do a huge amount of printing so maybe it needs bigger ink cartridges. But now as of 10/10/2018, the printer is almost useless. I did manage to discover that if I print a 1040EZ from Windows 7 (up to date) using Adobe Acrobat Reader DC "Continuous Release | Version 2019.008.20074" with the print in "grayscale/black and white" and "Save ink/toner" checkboxes enabled, only then will I get a readable printout. SIGH...
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Leduc

customer_reviews.title: Ok, I guess
customer_reviews.text: So, I've owned this printer for 10 months. We are a family of 4, 2 kids, 2 adults. I've replaced the original ink, which ran out quite quickly, with an off brand I bought here on Amazon. The off brand works fine and actually had lasted quite a while. The problem i have is with the maintenance required with the printer head. It has to be cleaned or it will not print correctly. The printer does come with a self cleaning mode. Also the time it takes to actually print after you press print is longer than I would like or expected. I suppose it's fine for home use but I would not but it again.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam & Tony

customer_reviews.title: Trouble-free all-in-one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an HP Photosmart c4780 inkjet all in one. We're very happy with it so far, 9 months later. Just started replacing ink cartridges, love that each color is separate, the cost to replace ink is incremental as each color goes low. The scanner and the EOM software work great on our wireless network - you can select the computer to send the scans to right from the panel on the printer. We mostly print office and household documents, not pictures. The printer software is much more usable than the HP stuff we had. The HP software was sketchy, as was the firmware in the printer. Not a lick of trouble with this Canon in 9 months!
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Federline

customer_reviews.title: Airprint works perfect, sleeps/powersaves great.  Excellent and simple to use.  Top unit of its product line
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for an MG 7500 model that I gave to my girlfriend. The Airprint feature of both models is critical to her needs not mine, but it is a very powerful solution for Apple product users. Print quality and features on this unit as fantastic. Ink usage is average, and ink is somewhat expensive. The sleep/wakeup features, work well - my epson and Lexmark units failed in this regard. My knock is that althought this is the 'top' unit, it really has no special features that make it exceptional above the unit 1 notch down for 30 less. For folks who want the best product in a niche this is it.
customer_reviews.author: ShuMO

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy and Love It
customer_reviews.text: I connect to the network via cable so cannot review the wireless setup which appears to be daunting at times. I had a really nice Dell color laser printer, which pooped out on me after many years of service, that was very economical to operate. I was reluctant to go with an inkjet printer as ink costs can really add up. However, the ink cartridges are very reasonable/affordable and the print quality, including borderless photos, is very good. It also has some other very nice features as well. I r-e-a-l-l-y like this printer and for under $100.00 you just cannot go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Canon - planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I used to like Canon (esp. cameras and printers) but this is now the 2nd version of this all-in-one printer that I've bought that worked ok for just under 2 years with minimal use and then had a fatal hardware error. Ink is too expensive to get a "B203" support code which directs you to call Canon customer support, only to be told that you must buy a *NEW* printer. First time this happened, I was annoyed. Second time this happened I am no longer buying Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer but a little quirky and uses a lot of ink.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a love/hate thing with this printer. Yes it prints well, does pics nice, works good on my wifi. But sometimes it doesn't want to come on, sometimes it doesn't want to print and it uses more ink than you would expect and you have to find some budget inks to buy. And sometimes have to reset a cartridge. But also works good with ipads too btw. Biggest problem with this printer seems to be if you don't use it for a week then the ink dries up to much and won't print. Going back to laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Dakar

customer_reviews.title: Don't print from WiFi, mostly
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice printer on paper. Read the online reviews. Canon printers don't print well on WiFi. They drop their connection. Then, you can spend hours restarting everything (network, computer, printer) and still it may or may not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Decatur, GA

customer_reviews.title: it makes this very annoying oscillating squeak sound
customer_reviews.text: This printer is driving me nuts! It has a SQUEAKY WHEEL! In between printings and when I turn it on, or sometimes when it is idle, i.e. any time the printer is operating but not printing a page, it makes this very annoying oscillating squeak sound. It's caused by some rotating mechanism in the printer. Oddly, when it's printing a page, it actually sounds normal. But the printer seems to do a lot of things when it's not printing. Perhaps its doing some head cleaning or calibration when idle. But this squeaky wheel sound is really really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Laine

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has an unresolved issue where it stops printing in black & white. I trouble shot & read comments from other people w/the same problem. Temporary fix was to set it to print everything in color, but that wasted a lot of ink & black print still came out way too light. I loved the gold color of the printer & the ease of the scanning software, but the printing issue makes it useless. I'm not a fan of separate color cartridges either. Save yourself the trouble & get something else!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn.A.

customer_reviews.title: Another A+ for Canon
customer_reviews.text: My last printer was a Canon, and it was a great one. However, after several years of use, it needed to be replaced. I searched carefully until I found one that I thought would meet my needs. This one fit the bill. It was easy to set up and get it going. I love the clarity of the printing and how quiet it is. However, since it turns itself off when not in use, it takes a few seconds to get it going again. That is not a problem for me since I rarely am in a time crunch when printing. I am very pleased and would buy it again- another A+ for Canon.
customer_reviews.author: mimijudy

customer_reviews.title: I would not hesitate to purchase this printer again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Canon MG7720 Wireless All-In-One Printer to make prints of artwork I created to sell. For this purpose, it was important to produce quality prints. Financially, I live on a tight budget, and needed an affordable printer. I chose this printer based on reviews I read online and here at Amazon. I am happy to say the Canon MG7720 did not disappoint. The prints are clear and the color is brilliant. I would not hesitate to purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Will not work if ANY color ink runs out, and it runs out fast!
customer_reviews.text: This printer will not copy or print if ANY of the 6 colored cartridges run out of ink. I just replaced several colors a month ago, including yellow, and it's already run out. I don't even use color that much! I mostly use it for music, black and white. But if there's any less-than-black grayish shading, it'll use the grey color, which is the most expensive ($12). I have no idea why the yellow is out already. I do NOT recommend this printer, since most of the time I try to use it, some ink has run out and it won't work. My last printer would print anyway. It's very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Sallin

customer_reviews.title: Great print quality. Canon has a slow warm up and slow shut down but most printers do unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: Great print quality but as with all Canon printers they take long to "warm up" and really long to shut down. Once it starts printing it is very fast and the paper output opens automatically so once printing it is very easy to use. Ink is very expensive if you buy the Canon ink but there are other ink options available that are way cheaper so that is a big plus. Very easy to print from my Android phone over WiFi or from windows laptop. I made sure that I did not sign up for automatic ink ordering - that is an option on the printer so make sure you don't do that as that gets very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great, but sometimes very slow "processing"
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a great little printer. Pictures come out better than when I order from Shutterfly! However, there is one thing I strongly dislike about it: the time it takes to PROCESS a print job! It doesn't always take a long time, but for example, it took about 8 minutes to get 2- 6 page statements printed just now. Once it starts printing it zips right through, but just to get it to START can take a while. (Displays the message, "Processing: this may take a while") I'm not sure if anyone else experiences this, but it's rather frustrating .. for someone impatient as I ;) Other than that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. Was a challenge to install since both the computer and web site did not list the MG7720 as an option to select. Even the manufacturer's disc did not list the MG7720! Was able to use Windows 10 installation and the printer is now working. Even used Windows 10 on the laptop and got the printer working using wireless. Have only printed documents so far and they are clear and crisp. Printer a little noisy but not bad. The bottom feeder tray is a bit of a nuisance. Much prefer a back feeder tray, that one reason it got 4 stars. Have not used the scanner yet. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: jim young

customer_reviews.title: Printers are so cheap that a spare is a good idea if you keep a large supply of new ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer was purchased as a spare for an identical printer that we are using now. Printers are so cheap that a spare is a good idea if you keep a large supply of new ink cartridges on hand. The manufacturer's like to change cartridge styles often enough that if you have an older printer and it goes out, your ink supply for that printer won't fit any new printer you can buy. Happened to me, hence the spare printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on the Canon 7720
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this Canon MG7720 Wireless printer unless you have a ton of patience! It will not connect to a wireless router without a lot of trying and retrying. It also takes 3 to 5 minutes sending print documents from online to be printed. We have uninstalled and reinstalled several times. If the print request is finally filled, we get an error message saying the document can't be printed. We are ready to go to Walmart and but another printer and trash this one! The ink ran out at the end of one month. Check around very carefully before spending money on this printer.
customer_reviews.author: retired

customer_reviews.title: Works with Linux!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a replacement for our mp620. It works perfectly with Linux (Mint 18) and I can scan over the network as well. The network setup menu is much better now and it prints much faster although my last printer was the mp620. I have noticed that the warm-up takes longer. It goes through all these gyrations like it's getting ready for prom. I'm not sure all of what its doing but hey do your thang MG7720. Lastly, the power saving options are great. No more having to remember to turn off the printer you can set a shutdown based on idle time.
customer_reviews.author: c3r3br0

customer_reviews.title: MG7720
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a technical person, a baby boomer generation, have used computers and smart devices. I've set up new printers before, most likely 10 years ago, which is the age of my printer that was not worth bringing in to service to replace ink absorber. This printer was a challenge to set up, but I managed it on my own. So far, I am happy with it. Love the duplex print function as I use to hand feed to achieve 2 sided printing.
customer_reviews.author: Violet Chu

customer_reviews.title: It seems so cool at first - operates really smoothly when it does ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems so cool at first - operates really smoothly when it does actually print. But the fact is, I can't get the darn thing to print. Lately, it will print 5-7 blank pages and just one of the ten slides I'm actually trying to print. I can spend 30 min to an hour just hoping (note: HOPING) that it will print. It may or may not actually print what I need. I recently got so frustrated as to plug back in the old cheap HP that I have that prints with lines in it just because it will AT LEAST PRINT. This is actually the most I've ever paid for a printer and it's the WORST.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Set up was fine until I had to download software from Canon's website ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know yet how this printer performs. It arrived timely. However, Amazon sent me a damaged product. It looked as if someone returned it and they repackaged it and I was its lucky recipient. I called Canon. Once they diagnosed the problem, they offered to send me a new printer from Canon and took back the damaged one so they could assess the problem. Set up was fine until I had to download software from Canon's website to my laptop. The link they provided didn't work. I went to their website and downloaded the driver myself but can't get it working. So need to make yet another call to Canon to connect wireless.
customer_reviews.author: gurlygurl180

customer_reviews.title: ... photos of the jewelry I've made and need a good printer. I was very happy with Cannon's older ...
customer_reviews.text: I print out photos of the jewelry I've made and need a good printer. I was very happy with Cannon's older model until (by my misuse) it quit. I was leary of a wireless printer, but I bought this one thinking that I could get someone to help install it. I was very happy that I was able to install it myself, it was easy. Cannon's MG7720's are as good as a good quality photo processing shop. It's flexibility for different sizes of prints is great. The only thing I don't love about it is the cost of the ink. If Cannon would cut its ink prices in half, Cannon would probably be the only printer being sold.
customer_reviews.author: Carl M. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: To me Canon prints fantastic color photos
customer_reviews.text: Have had Canon wireless all in one printers for quite a while. To me Canon prints fantastic color photos. Granted it uses a bit of ink, but when making "memories" to last, ink quantity is not in the picture. Like the ease of setting up the wireless printer, the two different size paper trays, but do miss the rear feed like for checks and the like. The printer can be set to quite mode, and it is quite and relatively fast. I do not have need for printing tons of documents, e-mails and the like, so to me print quality is more important than speed and quantity of ink used. I do like this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Flawed Airprinting
customer_reviews.text: Does not airprint “two sided” from any of our mobile devices. Therefore, all airprinting uses two pieces of paper instead of one. Contacted Canon and they could not help. If I want to print without wasting paper; I must send document to my desktop computer and print from there. My next printer will definitely not be a Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: don't buy it, expensive ink, won't print in b/w
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I'd returned this printer when i had the chance DO NOT buy it. Set up wasn't too hard, wireless works fine, but it has NEVER printed correctly in color and WONT print in black and white unless its a Tuesday at 4 and the wind is behind you or whatever the ridiculous glitch is that will print one page at a time in b/w but not multiple. I loved my last canon printer, this is a nightmare, never again.
customer_reviews.author: Voxchops

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: All worked fine for a year and a half until we replaced the ink with a 3rd party ink. We started getting an error 1256 and Canon CS claimed a sensor got dysfunctional. It seems very suspicious. Could it be a chip in the system that prevents 3rd party ink? it seems like there is. No compensation was offered by Canon. We spend so much money on this printer but sadly were left with a piece of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife again
customer_reviews.text: Setup and installation was a breeze. Fit right in to a tight space where the old Canon printer sat (which is why I chose this particular model). So far we are happy. Some reviewers say it's an ink hog but most of our printing from this is in black only so it's not so costly for us to run. Seems fast enough for our house use and the couple of photos I printer looked fine but I'm not expecting expert quality. Wife is happy with results and that's all that matters!
customer_reviews.author: PipeFighter

customer_reviews.title: Worked as described, good value
customer_reviews.text: We only need a printer for occasional household use. After the premature death of my second HP printer I decided to give Canon a try. So far no disappointments or problems, it works exactly as advertised. Easy wireless set up and all of our various devices (both PC and MAC) immediately recognized the unit and printed through it. Posted reviews stated that this printer works well with low cost non-Canon brand inks. I use them and can attest that this is true. Purchased the white model as it was a bit less expensive than the other colors offered. Very pleased with this printer would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: GJC

customer_reviews.title: This does everything I want a printer to do.
customer_reviews.text: This does everything I want a printer to do. It took me a while to find the exact printer because I wanted two paper trays (one for regular printer paper and one for photo paper). I wanted automatic duplexing (two-sided printing). I wanted internet connection (wireless). It has other features that I haven't checked out: Like printing directly from my phone or tablet or the cloud. One day...
customer_reviews.author: lg51

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but trouble!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this printer- I have had nothing but problems from the beginning and had my HP for years. I will never buy another Canon printer sadly. I am a photographer/graphic designer and love my canon camera but I had two different printers and both were awful. Never connected, jams, fed paper crooked, poor printing, now I just get a white page and I did a million things including buying $70 In new ink and nothing. I’m headed to the trash with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla G

customer_reviews.title: I've had it with these Canon printers...
customer_reviews.text: Way too finicky. There always seems to be SOME stupid issue with these things. Mine refuses to print anything stating that the printer is out of paper....when it is not. Full of paper. And, the real clincher is, there is NO way around this. You'd be an IDIOT to pay $500+ for this junk.
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Hampers

customer_reviews.title: The color photos are beautiful when printed - sharp and good color
customer_reviews.text: I chose this printer to make color photo prints as well as for other projects. The color photos are beautiful when printed - sharp and good color. However, the photos fade quickly. The printer is slow to respond to commands. I cannot find a delete button on the face of the printer so cannot quickly delete when needed. The paper tray holds a small amount of paper, fewer envelopes. It seems to always be running out of ink. I need a different printer!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy S.

customer_reviews.title: Clogged print heads after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked this printer while it worked. Then the black print head clogged and I tried all the home remedies and they didn't work. All I can do it buy new print heads for almost the same price as I originally paid for the whole printer. All I have is a big scanner now. I wouldn't recommend that anyone buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed. Have had two small Canon printers and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. Have had two small Canon printers and they meshed perfectly with my mac. This one, when it works is great, but unfortunately 90% of the time the USB connection doesn't see it. And sadly, and why I got this, connection to wifi has never worked. The computer and the printer are 3 feet apart.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Lots of problems.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has given me more grief than I like. Always running out of ink or doing something every time I want to print. Does not print envelopes well or cards. Leaves black edges on paper that is very thick. I have been very disappointed in this printer. Not what I expected from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Never really worked well and now doesn't print
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble setting it up and once set up, wouldn't print. Was on the phone with technical support for over an hour and they had to send another print cartridge. Finally worked. Then I didn't use it for a month and when I did send a doc to the printer, it wouldn't print. Tried everything, changed the cartridges, even tho they were at a sufficient level, ran diagnostics, clead the header, but still would not print effectively. This is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once installed this is a professional looking home printer
customer_reviews.text: Once I got someone techy to help set it up as I had trouble doing so, it runs great and I can print from phone, laptop and phone. It is not as good as my mp350 was as it doesn't have a feeder for scanning or copying and it does not have as many printing options as to sizes etc. it does not print legal sized docs. It is also not easy to understand and to read the manual in the computer is not handy as having the book in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Charlee D. Sandell

customer_reviews.title: The setup was somewhat tedious and confusing-- the menu asks you to start the ...
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, I was expecting a smaller sized printer and the footprint of this printer is a bit larger than what I expected. The setup was somewhat tedious and confusing-- the menu asks you to start the setup on the computer end while it calibrates but you really need to wait for it to finish to start the computer setup. The calibration took quite a few minutes. However, I give it 5 starts for the print quality and ease of use following installation. The Airprint quality (printing pdfs from my ipad or iphone) is the best I've seen from any printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installation somewhat tricky but great printer
customer_reviews.text: Does a beautiful job printing. Setup is not too hard but was time consuming. Took two of us, fairly tech literate, way over an hour to set it up. I am hoping the color inks last as they are expensive, but must say that this is a very clever and useful printer and I have no regrets despite the inconvenience of getting on the net etc. On first download from Canon, got a black screen before all was installed so rebooted, got the website again and finished the setup the second time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Loved my last cannon
customer_reviews.text: Multiple issues with this printer. Loved my last cannon... but this one is not programmed well, and prints incorrectly all the time. When reset, it will go to 150% or more ,which makes me spend more time getting it back to where I need it and it's not easy. Wastes pages, but mainly not happy about the time. Would never recommend this one. I also do not like the shiny finish. Shows dust right away and finger prints!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A.

customer_reviews.title: i LOVE THIS PRINTER/SCANNER
customer_reviews.text: i LOVE THIS PRINTER/SCANNER...IT HAS GIVEN ME GOOD SERVICE...jUST ONE SMALL PROBLEM...IT TELLS ME I'M OUT OF PAPER, BUT I AM NOT...IT IS THE PAPER FOR SOME REASON MOVING FORWARD AND THE UNIT SENSING THERE IS NO PAPER...I JUST OPEN THE DOOR AND ADJUST THE PAPER AND IT WORKS PERFECTLY...
customer_reviews.author: Laine Mellon

customer_reviews.title: updated... something on the inside is polluted.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Canon printer i had before this one better. This one doesn't have a feeder, but otherwise, it works well. Haven't played with the wireless feature. Update- It it September of 2017- I bought this in 2016. It is having serious trouble connecting and processing anything. The display says "Processing.... Please wait momentarily" ALL THE TIME. I've unplugged it, I've reset it, bought more ink, I've used the troubleshooter... nothing seems to convince the printer to print. I can also hear the insides moving around which sounds hopeful, but still no printed pages.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Crookes

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly.... Easy to set up... Wifi connects automatically Prints perfectly Connects to iPhone, iPad, and computer quickly and easily The only negative is that the paper feed is a two part thing and the part that feeds smaller than letter size is flimsy...
customer_reviews.author: sk-cjg - NH

customer_reviews.title: #1 drawback is it takes forever to print!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this p.o.s. It takes forever to print - goes through all the machinery noises, clanking here and there for a long time before actually printing. Lately mine has shown 'register' on the display which I've had to tap before getting it to print (it's already registered). Oh, and forget about wireless printing. After several attempts at setting this up, I gave up. I'm no techno whiz, but I'm not an idiot. This machine is most definitely not user-friendly, and it's only a short time before you have to replace the ink... and I rarely print! I am HUGELY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: The quality on the cheap HP is not nearly as good as the Canon
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August. Now on Nov 16th I cannot connect to this printer. And to top it off, I've spent over $100 on a multi-pack of replacement ink. I have replaced one ink cartridge so I cannot return the ink. We bought a compact HP printer the same day. The quality on the cheap HP is not nearly as good as the Canon, but the HP still works without any problems. And we have used the HP a lot more because the ink is a lot cheaper. Stay away from this Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: DonC

customer_reviews.title: Works great. There is a bit of a learning curve ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to print on CDs. Works great. There is a bit of a learning curve in trying to figure out everything. The instructions make some of the specialty printing look easy but I didn't find that to be the case. I managed to make it work (printing to CDs) but not as instructed. Seems like a good printer. Goes through the ink kind of quick on not a ton of printing. They say printer folk make their money on the purchase of ink cartridges-that seems to be true. But, as I mentioned, the quality is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality prints, goes through ink insanely fast
customer_reviews.text: This printer was OK for me for about 6 months. Then the quality of prints went down quickly. I tried doing all of the appropriate things to fix the issue-cleaning, deep cleaning, recalibrating, realigning printer heads etc... and still there are lines through every single image I print. I go out of my way now to avoid printing anything. I'm baffled by how quickly the cartridges need replacing (also a contributing factor to printing avoidance). I miss my old Canon printer which somehow lasted 9 years and printed high quality with reasonable use of ink until the very end. I definitely do not recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Canon Great Printer - would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: CANON it’s one of the best printers you can buy. I’ve used mine so many times I can’t tell you it’s still working great. I like that you can call CANON Customer Service at 1 (800) 652-2666 they are willing to help you set it up with no additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: SLR

customer_reviews.title: Uses ink too fast
customer_reviews.text: This printers ink is very expensive and it sucks out the yellow ink dry after only a few 8X10 photos. The worst part is, you have to keep the ink wells full or it wont let you scan a document or photo to save on your disk! This is really horrible. I want to be able to scan and save what I don't plan to print.
customer_reviews.author: ReneeLouise

customer_reviews.title: Bad Apple?
customer_reviews.text: Canon guy since I use several Canon cameras, have had several Canon printers which were about good for the price..After my last one stopped working and got this one.. Set up OK, BUT after that continuing paper jams! After several hours of checking and clearing the jams, I returned it for refund to Amazon. Bad apple I guess.. Won't buy another Canon as the noise and slowest was always a pain..
customer_reviews.author: Product User

customer_reviews.title: I set it up just a few days ago and it seems to be working fine. I was completely confused by the printed set ...
customer_reviews.text: All of my printers in the past have been HP, "to match" my computers. Now that I have a Lenovo, and a Canon camera, I decided to go with this one. I set it up just a few days ago and it seems to be working fine. I was completely confused by the printed set up instructions, so I inserted the disc in the computer, went to the Canon site and no problems ensued with the setup. I'm still getting used to Canon-speak, but print quality is good. I have not done color printing yet. The scan screen is only letter size, which surprised me for the rather large footprint of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: esd.

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing piece of equipment. I cannot speak to its long term durability because I've only owned it for 3 weeks. But I can say that it produces flawless, reliable printing with no jams, feeding issues, or printing anomalies, even when doing double sided printing (which can give printers the hiccups). Print quality for photos is fantastic. If I could choose one thing to criticize (and this is stretching it), it would be that after sitting idle for extended periods, it boots up and then goes into this seemingly endless series of chirps, clicks, hums and swooshes. But hey, maybe that's a good thing, like it's resetting itself or something. I am absolutely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It worked until it didn’t.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I sent a lot of money on paper and ink and had this working for a while. I tried today and it just stopped recognizing my paper size. Now I am stuck with a big piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy It Again
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, relatively low capacity printer. Best point: VERY quiet. Normal print speed, color quality is good. Relatively inexpensive ink cartridges. Only real down side is re-feeding a printed sheet for reuse on the other side is almost impossible. You would have to pull out the second paper holder, re insert the sheet, then refire the gizmo. It does not have a single sheet feed. That said, I would buy it again with no real qualms. It meets my needs, its quiet, it wasn't expensive, and the copies are clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dr H

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job - no complaints. Had more trouble with HP printers, that's why I tried Canon a few years ago. Go with the Sophia ink cartridges (i get them on Amazon). they are a fraction of the price of Canon, and i like them better because you can see how much ink remains through the clear plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D S

customer_reviews.title: Error messages that mean the printer is trash.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this printer for almost 3 years. The printer suddenly wouldn’t print yellow so I cleaned the yellow ink port. Now I get an error 203 message and can’t do anything. This message says to seek repair. Printhead damaged!!! Really?!? Will never buy Canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this printer. I am a scrapbooker and print lots of pictures. This printer was suppose to be a good but it waste too much ink. I was unable to be any picture crafts for a couple of months. I had just put new ink in it. 2 months later I went to print pictures for my daughter and the tank levels were low. The ink seems to be drying up if I'm not able to print and is using too much ink when I do print. The ink cost too much to replace every other month. I'm in the process of looking for a new one and it won't be a Canon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the quality of the print and the installation ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I purchased this unit. I was a little hesitant because of some of the reviews I read, but the unit had everything I was looking for. I've had no problems with it and it does everything I have asked it to do. I connected it to my network through the Ethernet port and all my devices found it immediately. I am pleased with the quality of the print and the installation was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul

customer_reviews.title: I actually really like this printer
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this printer. The only issue I have is that I cannot have more than one device connected to it or I start getting error messages which are kind of annoying, but other than that, it prints beautiful pictures and has many different options.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian

customer_reviews.title: It's been about 1 month and I'm satisfied. It's a pretty thing for a printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is really working out well. It's been about 1 month and I'm satisfied. It's a pretty thing for a printer, shiny and white. Print quality is good, not great but good enough. Scanning is easy, set up is fairly easy and Canon support is available by phone. I so appreciate that service.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Cook

customer_reviews.title: Not a good printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a good printer for the price...I tried Canon, based on their reputation and should have stayed with Epson, my usual go to printer. The Canon, looked good on the description but when I started to used it, it really showed its lacking. The printer will not print card stock reliably; doesn't have a rear feeder; the ink is expensive and doesn't last long; you can't print a document with multiple pages unless you hand feed one at a time, no feeder (really, in this day and age to have to hand feed a printer PDF!). I do not recommend this printer and will go back to Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Almaguer

product_meta.title: Canon MG7720 Wireless All-In-One Printer with Scanner and Copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing, with Airprint and Google Cloud Print compatible, White
product_meta.description: Color:White| Style:PrinterWireless All-In-One Small Printer with Scanner and Copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing with Air print and Google Cloud Print compatible
feature_bullets: Mobile Device Printing: Easily print from your iPhone, iPad, Android or tablet
Powerful Printing options: Air print, Google Cloud Print, NFC, Mopria, Canon PRINT app and more
CD/ DVD Printing: Enjoy the ability to create CD or DVD labels
Print with a touch from NFC-enabled mobile devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,564 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
